citation.article-title: Description of Azospira restricta sp. nov., a nitrogen-fixing bacterium isolated from groundwater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Azospira restricta sp. nov.
Azospira restricta (res.tric′ta. L. fem. part. adj. restricta limited, restricted, referring to the restricted spectrum of metabolized substrates).
On VM ethanol agar colonies are 1–2 mm diameter, translucent, greenish-yellow, smooth, convex with entire margins.
On R2A agar colonies are cream-coloured, smooth, convex with entire margins.
Growth occurs from 20 to 40 °C with optimal growth at 37 °C.
No growth is observed in the presence of 2 % NaCl (w/v).
Aesculin hydrolysis, gelatin hydrolysis, H2S production and acetoin production do not occur.
Negative for β-galactosidase, arginine dihydrogenase and lysine decarboxylase.
Strain SUA2T metabolizes β-hydroxybutyrate, γ-hydroxybutyrate, d,l-lactate and putrescine as growth substrates, but does not metabolize other substrates in Biolog GN and GP microplates.
Nitrate and perchlorate are not used as electron acceptors.
Growth occurs on β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, d,l-lactic acid and putrescine.
Dominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c, C17 : 0 cyclo, C10 : 0 3-OH, C18 : 1ω7c, C12 : 0 and C15 : 0.
The type strain SUA2T (=NRRL B-41660T=DSM 18626T=LMG 23819T) was isolated from groundwater.
